name: Glazed Salmon Teriyaki
description: Restaurant-quality salmon with homemade teriyaki glaze
instructions: Make teriyaki sauce: combine soy sauce, mirin, sugar, minced ginger and garlic in saucepan
Simmer sauce over medium heat for 5-7 minutes until thickened, set aside
Cook rice according to package instructions
Heat sesame oil in frying pan over medium-high heat
Pat salmon dry and place skin-side down in pan
Flip salmon and cook 3 minutes on other side
Brush teriyaki glaze generously over salmon
Steam pak choi in a separate pan for 3 minutes
Serve salmon over rice with pak choi, drizzle remaining sauce
Garnish with sliced spring onions and sesame seeds
tips: Don't move salmon while cooking - this creates a crispy skin
Make extra teriyaki sauce - it keeps for 2 weeks in the fridge
Check salmon is cooked by gently pressing - it should flake easily
